additional-exclude-classes.description: Additional class names to be excluded from schema generation. This list can be used to specify custom classes that should be excluded beyond the default exclusions. Classes specified here will be combined with the default excludeClasses list.

additional-properties.description: List of additional property paths to include

allow-additional-properties.description: Allow additional properties not defined in schema

exclude-classes.description: A list of fully qualified class names that should be excluded from schema generation. By default, includes ObjectMapper and ClassLoader classes to prevent processing of system-level classes that aren't relevant to configuration.

json-schema-properties-map.description: Map of property names or java objects to their type definitions. Used to store custom type mappings and property configurations that override or extend the default schema generation behavior.

missing-type-log.description: Controls whether missing type information should be logged. When true, logs will be generated for types that couldn't be mapped during schema generation. This is useful for debugging and identifying unmapped types.

console.description: Charset to use for console output.

file.description: Charset to use for file output.

config.description: Location of the logging configuration file. For instance, `classpath:logback.xml` for Logback.

exception-conversion-word.description: Conversion word used when logging exceptions.

clean-history-on-start.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup. Only supported with the default logback setup.

max-history.description: Maximum number of archive log files to keep. Only supported with the default logback setup.

max-size.description: Maximum log file size. Only supported with the default logback setup.

name.description: Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.

path.description: Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.

total-size-cap.description: Total size of log backups to be kept. Only supported with the default logback setup.

group.description: Log groups to quickly change multiple loggers at the same time. For instance, `logging.group.db=org.hibernate,org.springframework.jdbc`.

include-application-group.description: Whether to include the application group in the logs.

include-application-name.description: Whether to include the application name in the logs.

level.description: Log levels severity mapping. For instance, `logging.level.org.springframework=DEBUG`.

override.description: Overriding configuration files used to create a composite configuration. Can be prefixed with 'optional:' to only load the override if it exists.

clean-history-on-start.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup.

file-name-pattern.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names.

max-history.description: Maximum number of archive log files to keep.

total-size-cap.description: Total size of log backups to be kept.

console.description: Appender pattern for output to the console. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

correlation.description: Appender pattern for log correlation. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

dateformat.description: Appender pattern for log date format.

file.description: Appender pattern for output to a file. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

rolling-file-name.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

register-shutdown-hook.description: Register a shutdown hook for the logging system when it is initialized. Disabled automatically when deployed as a war file.

console.description: Structured logging format for output to the console. Must be either a format id or a fully qualified class name.

file.description: Structured logging format for output to a file. Must be either a format id or a fully qualified class name.

add.description: Additional members that should be added to structured logging JSON

include.description: Whether context data should be included in the JSON.

prefix.description: The prefix to use when inserting context data.

customizer.description: Fully qualified class names of StructuredLoggingJsonMembersCustomizer implementations

exclude.description: Member paths that should be excluded from structured logging JSON

include.description: Member paths that should be included in structured logging JSON

rename.description: Mapping between member paths and an alternative name that should be used in structured logging JSON

include-common-frames.description: Whether common frames should be included.

include-hashes.description: Whether stack trace hashes should be included.

printer.description: Name of the printer to use. Can be 'standard', 'logging-system', or the fully-qualified class name of a StackTracePrinter. When not specified 'logging-system' or 'standard' will be used depending if other properties are set.

root.description: Root ordering (root first or root last).

console.description: Log level threshold for console output.

file.description: Log level threshold for file output.

address.description: Network address to which the server should bind.

enabled.description: Whether response compression is enabled.

excluded-user-agents.description: Comma-separated list of user agents for which responses should not be compressed.

mime-types.description: Comma-separated list of MIME types that should be compressed.

min-response-size.description: Minimum "Content-Length" value that is required for compression to be performed.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the default error page displayed in browsers in case of a server error.
Whether to enable HTTP/2 support, if the current environment supports it.

custom-format.description: Custom log format, see org.eclipse.jetty.server.CustomRequestLog. If defined, overrides the "format" configuration key.

enabled.description: Enable access log.

file-date-format.description: Date format to place in log file name.

filename.description: Log filename. If not specified, logs redirect to "System.err".

ignore-paths.description: Request paths that should not be logged.

retention-period.description: Number of days before rotated log files are deleted.

connection-idle-timeout.description: Time that the connection can be idle before it is closed.

max-connections.description: Maximum number of connections that the server accepts and processes at any given time.

max-http-form-post-size.description: Maximum size of the form content in any HTTP post request.

max-http-response-header-size.description: Maximum size of the HTTP response header.

acceptors.description: Number of acceptor threads to use. When the value is -1, the default, the number of acceptors is derived from the operating environment.

max.description: Maximum number of threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

max-queue-capacity.description: Maximum capacity of the thread pool's backing queue. A default is computed based on the threading configuration.

min.description: Minimum number of threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

selectors.description: Number of selector threads to use. When the value is -1, the default, the number of selectors is derived from the operating environment.

max-http-request-header-size.description: Maximum size of the HTTP request header. Refer to the documentation for your chosen embedded server for details of exactly how this limit is applied. For example, Netty applies the limit separately to each individual header in the request whereas Tomcat applies the limit to the combined size of the request line and all of the header names and values in the request.

connection-timeout.description: Connection timeout of the Netty channel.

h2c-max-content-length.description: Maximum content length of an H2C upgrade request.

idle-timeout.description: Idle timeout of the Netty channel. When not specified, an infinite timeout is used.

initial-buffer-size.description: Initial buffer size for HTTP request decoding.

max-initial-line-length.description: Maximum length that can be decoded for an HTTP request's initial line.

max-keep-alive-requests.description: Maximum number of requests that can be made per connection. By default, a connection serves unlimited number of requests.

validate-headers.description: Whether to validate headers when decoding requests.

http-only.description: Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for the cookie.

max-age.description: Maximum age of the cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. A positive value indicates when the cookie expires relative to the current time. A value of 0 means the cookie should expire immediately. A negative value means no "Max-Age".

partitioned.description: Whether the generated cookie carries the Partitioned attribute.

secure.description: Whether to always mark the cookie as secure.

max-sessions.description: Maximum number of sessions that can be stored.

timeout.description: Session timeout. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

server-header.description: Value to use for the Server response header (if empty, no header is sent).

charset.description: Charset of HTTP requests and responses. Added to the "Content-Type" header if not set explicitly.

enabled.description: Whether to enable http encoding support.

force.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests and responses.

force-request.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests. Defaults to true when "force" has not been specified.

force-response.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP responses.

mapping.description: Mapping of locale to charset for response encoding.

class-name.description:
Class name of the servlet to use for JSPs. If registered is true and this class
	 * is on the classpath then it will be registered.

init-parameters.description: Init parameters used to configure the JSP servlet.

registered.description: Whether the JSP servlet is registered.

register-default-servlet.description: Whether to register the default Servlet with the container.

http-only.description: Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for the cookie.

max-age.description: Maximum age of the cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. A positive value indicates when the cookie expires relative to the current time. A value of 0 means the cookie should expire immediately. A negative value means no "Max-Age".

partitioned.description: Whether the generated cookie carries the Partitioned attribute.

secure.description: Whether to always mark the cookie as secure.

persistent.description: Whether to persist session data between restarts.

store-dir.description: Directory used to store session data.

timeout.description: Session timeout. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

shutdown.description: Type of shutdown that the server will support.

bundle.description: Name of a configured SSL bundle.

certificate.description: Path to a PEM-encoded SSL certificate file.

certificate-private-key.description: Path to a PEM-encoded private key file for the SSL certificate.

client-auth.description: Client authentication mode. Requires a trust store.

enabled.description: Whether to enable SSL support.

key-alias.description: Alias that identifies the key in the key store.

key-password.description: Password used to access the key in the key store.

key-store.description: Path to the key store that holds the SSL certificate (typically a jks file).

key-store-password.description: Password used to access the key store.

server-name-bundles.description: Mapping of host names to SSL bundles for SNI configuration.

trust-certificate.description: Path to a PEM-encoded SSL certificate authority file.

trust-certificate-private-key.description: Path to a PEM-encoded private key file for the SSL certificate authority.

trust-store.description: Trust store that holds SSL certificates.

trust-store-password.description: Password used to access the trust store.

accept-count.description: Maximum queue length for incoming connection requests when all possible request processing threads are in use.

buffered.description: Whether to buffer output such that it is flushed only periodically.

check-exists.description: Whether to check for log file existence so it can be recreated if an external process has renamed it.

condition-if.description: Whether logging of the request will only be enabled if "ServletRequest.getAttribute(conditionIf)" does not yield null.

condition-unless.description: Whether logging of the request will only be enabled if "ServletRequest.getAttribute(conditionUnless)" yield null.

directory.description: Directory in which log files are created. Can be absolute or relative to the Tomcat base dir.

enabled.description: Enable access log.

encoding.description: Character set used by the log file. Default to the system default character set.

file-date-format.description: Date format to place in the log file name.

ipv6-canonical.description: Whether to use IPv6 canonical representation format as defined by RFC 5952.

locale.description: Locale used to format timestamps in log entries and in log file name suffix. Default to the default locale of the Java process.

max-days.description: Number of days to retain the access log files before they are removed.

rename-on-rotate.description: Whether to defer inclusion of the date stamp in the file name until rotate time.

request-attributes-enabled.description: Set request attributes for the IP address, Hostname, protocol, and port used for the request.

rotate.description: Whether to enable access log rotation.

additional-tld-skip-patterns.description: List of additional patterns that match jars to ignore for TLD scanning. The special '?' and '*' characters can be used in the pattern to match one and only one character and zero or more characters respectively.

background-processor-delay.description: Delay between the invocation of backgroundProcess methods. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

basedir.description: Tomcat base directory. If not specified, a temporary directory is used.

connection-timeout.description: Amount of time the connector will wait, after accepting a connection, for the request URI line to be presented.

keep-alive-timeout.description: Time to wait for another HTTP request before the connection is closed. When not set the connectionTimeout is used. When set to -1 there will be no timeout.

max-connections.description: Maximum number of connections that the server accepts and processes at any given time. Once the limit has been reached, the operating system may still accept connections based on the "acceptCount" property.

max-http-form-post-size.description: Maximum size of the form content in any HTTP post request.

max-http-response-header-size.description: Maximum size of the HTTP response header.

max-keep-alive-requests.description: Maximum number of HTTP requests that can be pipelined before the connection is closed. When set to 0 or 1, keep-alive and pipelining are disabled. When set to -1, an unlimited number of pipelined or keep-alive requests are allowed.

max-parameter-count.description: Maximum number of parameters (GET plus POST) that will be automatically parsed by the container. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

max-part-count.description: Maximum total number of parts permitted in a multipart/form-data request. Requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

max-part-header-size.description: Maximum per-part header size permitted in a multipart/form-data request. Requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

max-swallow-size.description: Maximum amount of request body to swallow.

enabled.description: Whether Tomcat's MBean Registry should be enabled.

processor-cache.description: Maximum number of idle processors that will be retained in the cache and reused with a subsequent request. When set to -1 the cache will be unlimited with a theoretical maximum size equal to the maximum number of connections.

redirect-context-root.description: Whether requests to the context root should be redirected by appending a / to the path. When using SSL terminated at a proxy, this property should be set to false.

relaxed-path-chars.description: List of additional unencoded characters that should be allowed in URI paths. Only "< > [ \ ] ^ ` { | }" are allowed.

relaxed-query-chars.description: List of additional unencoded characters that should be allowed in URI query strings. Only "< > [ \ ] ^ ` { | }" are allowed.

host-header.description: Name of the HTTP header from which the remote host is extracted.

internal-proxies.description: Regular expression that matches proxies that are to be trusted.

port-header.description: Name of the HTTP header used to override the original port value.

protocol-header.description: Header that holds the incoming protocol, usually named "X-Forwarded-Proto".

protocol-header-https-value.description: Value of the protocol header indicating whether the incoming request uses SSL.

remote-ip-header.description: Name of the HTTP header from which the remote IP is extracted. For instance, 'X-FORWARDED-FOR'.

trusted-proxies.description: Regular expression defining proxies that are trusted when they appear in the "remote-ip-header" header.

allow-caching.description: Whether static resource caching is permitted for this web application.

cache-ttl.description: Time-to-live of the static resource cache.

max.description: Maximum amount of worker threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

max-queue-capacity.description: Maximum capacity of the thread pool's backing queue. This setting only has an effect if the value is greater than 0.

min-spare.description: Minimum amount of worker threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

uri-encoding.description: Character encoding to use to decode the URI.

use-relative-redirects.description: Whether HTTP 1.1 and later location headers generated by a call to sendRedirect will use relative or absolute redirects.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the access log.

rotate.description: Whether to enable access log rotation.

allow-encoded-slash.description: Whether the server should decode percent encoded slash characters. Enabling encoded slashes can have security implications due to different servers interpreting the slash differently. Only enable this if you have a legacy application that requires it. Has no effect when server.undertow.decode-slash is set.

always-set-keep-alive.description: Whether the 'Connection: keep-alive' header should be added to all responses, even if not required by the HTTP specification.

buffer-size.description: Size of each buffer. The default is derived from the maximum amount of memory that is available to the JVM.

decode-slash.description: Whether encoded slash characters (%2F) should be decoded. Decoding can cause security problems if a front-end proxy does not perform the same decoding. Only enable this if you have a legacy application that requires it. When set, server.undertow.allow-encoded-slash has no effect.

decode-url.description: Whether the URL should be decoded. When disabled, percent-encoded characters in the URL will be left as-is.

direct-buffers.description: Whether to allocate buffers outside the Java heap. The default is derived from the maximum amount of memory that is available to the JVM.

eager-filter-init.description: Whether servlet filters should be initialized on startup.

max-cookies.description: Maximum number of cookies that are allowed. This limit exists to prevent hash collision based DOS attacks.

max-headers.description: Maximum number of headers that are allowed. This limit exists to prevent hash collision based DOS attacks.

max-http-post-size.description: Maximum size of the HTTP post content. When the value is -1, the default, the size is unlimited.

max-parameters.description: Maximum number of query or path parameters that are allowed. This limit exists to prevent hash collision based DOS attacks.

no-request-timeout.description: Amount of time a connection can sit idle without processing a request, before it is closed by the server.

server.description: Server options as defined in io.undertow.UndertowOptions.

socket.description: Socket options as defined in org.xnio.Options.

preserve-path-on-forward.description: Whether to preserve the path of a request when it is forwarded.

io.description: Number of I/O threads to create for the worker. The default is derived from the number of available processors.

worker.description: Number of worker threads. The default is 8 times the number of I/O threads.

connect-timeout.description: Default connect timeout for a client HTTP request.

factory.description: Default factory used for a client HTTP request.

read-timeout.description: Default read timeout for a client HTTP request.

location.description: Location of the generated build-info.properties file.
Location of the generated git.properties file.

constructor-detector.description: Strategy to use to auto-detect constructor, and in particular behavior with single-argument constructors.

date-format.description: Date format string or a fully-qualified date format class name. For instance, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'.

default-leniency.description: Global default setting (if any) for leniency.

default-property-inclusion.description: Controls the inclusion of properties during serialization. Configured with one of the values in Jackson's JsonInclude.Include enumeration.

deserialization.description: Jackson on/off features that affect the way Java objects are deserialized.

property-naming-strategy.description: One of the constants on Jackson's PropertyNamingStrategies. Can also be a fully-qualified class name of a PropertyNamingStrategy implementation.

serialization.description: Jackson on/off features that affect the way Java objects are serialized.

time-zone.description: Time zone used when formatting dates. For instance, "America/Los_Angeles" or "GMT+10".

visibility.description: Jackson visibility thresholds that can be used to limit which methods (and fields) are auto-detected.

enabled.description: Expose Spring's management beans to the JMX domain.

timeout-per-shutdown-phase.description: Timeout for the shutdown of any phase (group of SmartLifecycle beans with the same 'phase' value).

request-timeout.description: Amount of time before asynchronous request handling times out. If this value is not set, the default timeout of the underlying implementation is used.

default-content-types.description: List of default content types to be used when no specific content type is requested.

favor-parameter.description: Whether a request parameter ("format" by default) should be used to determine the requested media type.

media-types.description: Map file extensions to media types for content negotiation. For instance, yml to text/yaml.

parameter-name.description: Query parameter name to use when "favor-parameter" is enabled.

dispatch-options-request.description: Whether to dispatch OPTIONS requests to the FrameworkServlet doService method.

dispatch-trace-request.description: Whether to dispatch TRACE requests to the FrameworkServlet doService method.

date.description: Date format to use, for example 'dd/MM/yyyy'. Used for formatting of java.util.Date and java.time.LocalDate.

date-time.description: Date-time format to use, for example 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'. Used for formatting of java.time's LocalDateTime, OffsetDateTime, and ZonedDateTime.

time.description: Time format to use, for example 'HH:mm:ss'. Used for formatting of java.time's LocalTime and OffsetTime.

enabled.description: Whether to enable Spring's FormContentFilter.
Whether to enable Spring's HiddenHttpMethodFilter.

log-request-details.description: Whether logging of (potentially sensitive) request details at DEBUG and TRACE level is allowed.

log-resolved-exception.description: Whether to enable warn logging of exceptions resolved by a "HandlerExceptionResolver", except for "DefaultHandlerExceptionResolver".

message-codes-resolver-format.description: Formatting strategy for message codes. For instance, 'PREFIX_ERROR_CODE'.

matching-strategy.description: Choice of strategy for matching request paths against registered mappings.

enabled.description: Whether RFC 9457 Problem Details support should be enabled.

publish-request-handled-events.description: Whether to publish a ServletRequestHandledEvent at the end of each request.

load-on-startup.description: Load on startup priority of the dispatcher servlet.

path.description: Path of the dispatcher servlet. Setting a custom value for this property is not compatible with the PathPatternParser matching strategy.

static-path-pattern.description: Path pattern used for static resources.

webjars-path-pattern.description: Path pattern used for WebJar assets.

enabled.description: Whether to enable support of multipart uploads.

file-size-threshold.description: Threshold after which files are written to disk.

resolve-lazily.description: Whether to resolve the multipart request lazily at the time of file or parameter access.

strict-servlet-compliance.description: Whether to resolve the multipart request strictly complying with the Servlet specification, only to be used for "multipart/form-data" requests.

continue-on-error.description: Whether initialization should continue when an error occurs.

data-locations.description: Locations of the data (DML) scripts to apply to the database.

enabled.description: Whether basic script-based initialization of an SQL database is enabled.

encoding.description: Encoding of the schema and data scripts.

mode.description: Mode to apply when determining whether initialization should be performed.

password.description: Password of the database to use when applying initialization scripts (if different).

platform.description: Platform to use in the default schema or data script locations, schema-${platform}.sql and data-${platform}.sql.

schema-locations.description: Locations of the schema (DDL) scripts to apply to the database.

separator.description: Statement separator in the schema and data scripts.

username.description: Username of the database to use when applying initialization scripts (if different).

quiet-period.description: Quiet period, after which changes are detected.

mode.description: Determine when the task executor is to be created.

allow-core-thread-timeout.description: Whether core threads are allowed to time out. This enables dynamic growing and shrinking of the pool. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

core-size.description: Core number of threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

keep-alive.description: Time limit for which threads may remain idle before being terminated. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

max-size.description: Maximum allowed number of threads. If tasks are filling up the queue, the pool can expand up to that size to accommodate the load. Ignored if the queue is unbounded. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

queue-capacity.description: Queue capacity. An unbounded capacity does not increase the pool and therefore ignores the "max-size" property. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

accept-tasks-after-context-close.description: Whether to accept further tasks after the application context close phase has begun.

await-termination.description: Whether the executor should wait for scheduled tasks to complete on shutdown.

await-termination-period.description: Maximum time the executor should wait for remaining tasks to complete.

concurrency-limit.description: Set the maximum number of parallel accesses allowed. -1 indicates no concurrency limit at all.

reject-tasks-when-limit-reached.description: Whether to reject tasks when the concurrency limit has been reached.

thread-name-prefix.description: Prefix to use for the names of newly created threads.

size.description: Maximum allowed number of threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

await-termination.description: Whether the executor should wait for scheduled tasks to complete on shutdown.

await-termination-period.description: Maximum time the executor should wait for remaining tasks to complete.

concurrency-limit.description: Set the maximum number of parallel accesses allowed. -1 indicates no concurrency limit at all.

thread-name-prefix.description: Prefix to use for the names of newly created threads.

locale.description: Locale to use. By default, this locale is overridden by the "Accept-Language" header.

locale-resolver.description: Define how the locale should be resolved.

add-mappings.description: Whether to enable default resource handling.

cache-private.description: Indicate that the response message is intended for a single user and must not be stored by a shared cache.

cache-public.description: Indicate that any cache may store the response.

max-age.description: Maximum time the response should be cached, in seconds if no duration suffix is not specified.

must-revalidate.description: Indicate that once it has become stale, a cache must not use the response without re-validating it with the server.

no-cache.description: Indicate that the cached response can be reused only if re-validated with the server.

no-store.description: Indicate to not cache the response in any case.

no-transform.description: Indicate intermediaries (caches and others) that they should not transform the response content.

proxy-revalidate.description: Same meaning as the "must-revalidate" directive, except that it does not apply to private caches.

s-max-age.description: Maximum time the response should be cached by shared caches, in seconds if no duration suffix is not specified.

stale-if-error.description: Maximum time the response may be used when errors are encountered, in seconds if no duration suffix is not specified.

stale-while-revalidate.description: Maximum time the response can be served after it becomes stale, in seconds if no duration suffix is not specified.

period.description: Cache period for the resources served by the resource handler. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. Can be overridden by the 'spring.web.resources.cache.cachecontrol' properties.

use-last-modified.description: Whether we should use the "lastModified" metadata of the files in HTTP caching headers.

cache.description: Whether to enable caching in the Resource chain.

compressed.description: Whether to enable resolution of already compressed resources (gzip, brotli). Checks for a resource name with the '.gz' or '.br' file extensions.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the Spring Resource Handling chain. By default, disabled unless at least one strategy has been enabled.
Whether to enable the content Version Strategy.

paths.description: List of patterns to apply to the content Version Strategy.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the fixed Version Strategy.

paths.description: List of patterns to apply to the fixed Version Strategy.

version.description: Version string to use for the fixed Version Strategy.

static-locations.description: Locations of static resources. Defaults to classpath:[/META-INF/resources/, /resources/, /static/, /public/].

base-path.description: Base path for all web handlers.

date.description: Date format to use, for example 'dd/MM/yyyy'. Used for formatting of java.util.Date and java.time.LocalDate.

date-time.description: Date-time format to use, for example 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'. Used for formatting of java.time's LocalDateTime, OffsetDateTime, and ZonedDateTime.

time.description: Time format to use, for example 'HH:mm:ss'. Used for formatting of java.time's LocalTime and OffsetTime.

enabled.description: Whether to enable Spring's HiddenHttpMethodFilter.

file-storage-directory.description: Directory used to store file parts larger than 'maxInMemorySize'. Default is a directory named 'spring-multipart' created under the system temporary directory. Ignored when using the PartEvent streaming support.

headers-charset.description: Character set used to decode headers.

max-disk-usage-per-part.description: Maximum amount of disk space allowed per part. Default is -1 which enforces no limits.

max-headers-size.description: Maximum amount of memory allowed per headers section of each part. Set to -1 to enforce no limits.

max-in-memory-size.description: Maximum amount of memory allowed per part before it's written to disk. Set to -1 to store all contents in memory.

max-parts.description: Maximum number of parts allowed in a given multipart request. Default is -1 which enforces no limits.

enabled.description: Whether RFC 9457 Problem Details support should be enabled.

static-path-pattern.description: Path pattern used for static resources.

webjars-path-pattern.description: Path pattern used for WebJar assets.

path.description: Path that serves as the base URI for the services.

init.description: Servlet init parameters to pass to Spring Web Services.

load-on-startup.description: Load on startup priority of the Spring Web Services servlet.

wsdl-locations.description: Comma-separated list of locations of WSDLs and accompanying XSDs to be exposed as beans.
